name: Shodan
description: This app integrates with the Shodan Search engine. It supports search and on-demand scanning APIs

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
Returns all services that have been found on the given host IP
actions.verbose:
Parameters:
ip: [String] Host IP address
history (optional): [Boolean] True if all historical banners should be returned (default: False)
minify (optional): [Boolean] True to only return the list of ports and the general host information, no banners. (default: False).

history.description: True if all historical banners should be returned (default: False)

minify.description: True to only return the list of ports and the general host information, no banners. (default: False)

actions.verbose: This method behaves identical to "/shodan/host/search" with the only difference that this method does not return any host results, it only returns the total number of results that matched the query and any facet information that was requested. As a result this method does not consume query credits.

query.description: Shodan search query. The provided string is used to search the database of banners in Shodan

facets.description: A comma-separated list of properties to get summary information on

actions.description: Search Shodan using the same query syntax as the website and use facets to get summary information for different properties
actions.verbose:
Requirements
This method may use API query credits depending on usage. If any of the following criteria are met, your account will be deducted 1 query credit:

1. The search query contains a filter.
2. Accessing results past the 1st page using the "page". For every 100 results past the 1st page 1 query credit is deducted.

facets.description: A comma-separated list of properties to get summary information on

page.description: The page number to page through results 100 at a time (default: 1)

minify.description: Whether or not to truncate some of the larger fields (default: True)

actions.verbose: This method returns a list of facets that can be used to get a breakdown of the top values for a property or search filters that can be used in the search query.

actions.description: Break the search query into tokens
actions.verbose: This method lets you determine which filters are being used by the query string and what parameters were provided to the filters.

query.description: Shodan search query. The provided string is used to search the database of banners in Shodan

actions.description: List all ports that Shodan is crawling on the Internet
actions.verbose: This method returns a list of port numbers that the crawlers are looking for.

actions.description: List all protocols that can be used when performing on-demand Internet scans via Shodan
actions.verbose: This method returns an object containing all the protocols that can be used when launching an Internet scan.

actions.description: Request Shodan to crawl an IP/ netblock
actions.verbose:
Use this method to request Shodan to crawl a network.

Requirements
This method uses API scan credits: 1 IP consumes 1 scan credit. You must have a paid API plan (either one-time payment or subscription) in order to use this method.

ip_list.description: A comma-separated list of IPs or netblocks (in CIDR notation) that should get crawled. ip_1,ip_2,...,ip_n

force.description: Whether or not to force Shodan to re-scan the provided IPs. Only available to enterprise users

actions.description: A pipe-separated list of IPs or netblocks (in CIDR notation) that should get crawled with services
actions.verbose:
By default, the Shodan crawlers will check all the standard ports it normally crawls. However, you can also provide the services, a specific list of ports/ protocols you'd like the crawlers to use. A service is defined as a [port, protocol] in this action.

This action requires a pipe-separated list of IP addresses along with their services. 
Provide input to this action in the following format,

ip_1:[ip_1_service_1],[ip_1_service_2] | ip_2:[ip_2_service_1],[ip_2_service_2] | ...

example:
1.1.1.1: [[53,dns-udp], [443, https]] | 8.8.8.8: [[53, dns-tcp]] | 12.8.8.8: [[53, dns-tcp]].

ip_with_services.description: A pipe-separated list of IP addresses along with their services. ip_1:[ip_1_service_1],[ip_1_service_2] | ip_2:[ip_2_service_1],[ip_2_service_2] | and so on

force.description: Whether or not to force Shodan to re-scan the provided IPs. Only available to enterprise users

actions.description: Crawl the Internet for a specific port and protocol using Shodan
actions.verbose:
Use this method to request Shodan to crawl the Internet for a specific port.

Requirements
This method is restricted to security researchers and companies with a Shodan Enterprise Data license. To apply for access to this method as a researcher, please email jmath@shodan.io with information about your project. Access is restricted to prevent abuse.

Parameters
port: [Integer] The port that Shodan should crawl the Internet for.
protocol: [String] The name of the protocol that should be used to interrogate the port. See /shodan/protocols for a list of supported protocols.

port.description: The port that Shodan should crawl the Internet for

protocol.description: The name of the protocol that should be used to interrogate the port. See /shodan/protocols for a list of supported protocols

actions.description: Get list of all the created scans
actions.verbose: Returns a listing of all the on-demand scans that are currently active on the account.

page_number.description: From page number. Each page contains 100 scan results in it

actions.description: Get the status of a scan request
actions.verbose:
Check the progress of a previously submitted scan request. Possible values for the status are:
SUBMITTING,
QUEUE,
PROCESSING,
DONE.

id.description: The unique scan ID that was returned by /shodan/scan
